;If there ever was a motor vehicle that was hard to classify, it would be the 2012 Porsche Cayenne. It possesses all of the conveniences of a luxury SUV, the convenience of a car-based crossover and the power of an off-roader. Because it is a Porsche, it is safe to assume that you will get opulence and sportiness in a quality vehicle. Even though you can probably get more cargo room in other SUVs, for individuals who want a Porsche they really care.
;
;The all-wheel drive of your Cayenne gives you exceptional performance and handling plus it features a variety of engine options. Available in different trims which are aligned to the choice of engine, the Porsche Cayenne is a five-passenger mid-size SUV. The standard Cayenne features automatic front lights, 18-inch wheels, power lift-gate, eight-way power front seats, automatic wipers and more. The standard for the basic 2012 Porsche Cayenne is a six-speed manual transmission all-wheel drive and driven by a 3.6 liter V6 engine. The Cayenne can conserve fuel using an automatic stop/start feature and you can get the SUV with an eight-speed automatic transmission.
;
;It is calculated that this Cayenne V6 should go from 0 to 60 mph in 7.4 seconds with the automatic, and 7.1 seconds with the manual transmission. The automatic should get about 16 mpg inside the city and 23 mpg driving on the road while the manual is about 1 mpg less for both. If you would like something a little more powerful, then you'll be able to consider the Cayenne S. The 2012 Porsche Cayenne S Hybrid offers better fuel economy of 20/24/21 and it provides a 3.0-liter V6 with a 34W electric motor and an eight speed automatic transmission. But if you seriously want power and don't care about fuel economy, then you can think about the more popular Cayenne Turbo. A few of the standard safety features are reliability and traction regulation, anti-lock brakes, driver knee airbags, front side airbags, along with many other options.
;
;Only a few SUVs are offered in a manual transmission design but the manual version of the 2012 Porsche Cayenne is not any quicker. The accuracy and precision steering and handling makes it an extraordinary SUV. 60% of the thrust travels to the back wheels in this all-wheel drive system which provides an extra boost. The discretionary active suspension will help you to do light off-roading or drive long distances. You receive sure-footed handling and poise with the Cayenne S, which is V8 powered, along with a more generous portion of muscle. However, the Cayenne S Hybrid is not as enjoyable since the regenerative brakes and electric power steering feels odd for a powerful car. Despite the downside, the hybrid is most likely the best SUV to combine great fuel economy with high performance driving.
;
;If you test out the 2012 Porsche Cayenne mid-size SUV, you will find it being very comfortable. Even though it is the least expensive Porsche you can get, it is nonetheless expensive compared to other SUVs. If you don't plan to spend a great deal but want a Porsche, the basic model should meet your needs. It can be nice that there is a hybrid choice as well.
;
